intro: Galium luteum, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems and are yellowish-green to pale yellow in color. Galium luteum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
